meanings.sent1: Winning the game was a walkover for our team.
meanings.sent2: The exam was a walkover for the top student in the class.
meanings.sent3: The walkover in the competition left everyone surprised.
meanings.sent4: Her presentation was a walkover, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The walkover in the debate made a lasting impression on the judges.

meanings.definition: A horse race or boxing match in which only one competitor participates.
meanings.sent1: The horse won the race as it was a walkover.
meanings.sent2: The boxer was declared the winner due to a walkover.
meanings.sent3: The walkover in the boxing match was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The horse's walkover in the race was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The walkover in the competition made the crowd cheer for the lone participant.
